doc.after: Thatcher became a Privy Councillor (PC) upon becoming Secretary of State for Education and Science in 1970.[284] She was appointed a Member of the Order of Merit (OM) (an order within the personal gift of the Queen) within two weeks of leaving office. Denis Thatcher was made a Baronet at the same time.[285] She became a peer in the House of Lords in 1992 with a life peerage as Baroness Thatcher, of Kesteven in the County of Lincolnshire.[206][286] She was appointed a Lady Companion of the Order of the Garter, the UK's highest order of chivalry, in 1995.[287]
